# Build a balanced logistic regression
clf_lr = LogisticRegression(class_weight='balanced', solver='liblinear', random_state=42)

# Build and fit a bagging classifier
clf_bag = BaggingClassifier(base_estimator=clf_lr, n_estimators=10, oob_score=True, random_state=500)
clf_bag.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Evaluate the accuracy on the test set and show the out-of-bag score
pred = clf_bag.predict(X_test)
print('Accuracy:  {:.2f}'.format(accuracy_score(y_test, pred)))
print('OOB-Score: {:.2f}'.format(clf_bag.oob_score_))

# Print the confusion matrix
print(confusion_matrix(y_test, pred))

The maximum number of features indicated in the code is 1000. The `balanced` class_weight argument in the `LogisticRegression` constructor specifies that each sample should have equal influence on the model, which requires at least 1000 features. If the number of features is less than 1000, the code will throw an error.
where do include the argument max_features in the code above

To include the argument max_features in the code above, you can add it after the constructor of the LogisticRegression class, like this:


```python
clf = LogisticRegression(max_features=1000,...)
```
